Utterance: Hi! Welcome back! It’s great to see you again. How have things been going since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! Things have been going well. I successfully delivered my presentation last week!
That’s fantastic! How did it go?
It went better than I expected. I was nervous, but I used the breathing techniques, and it really helped.
I’m so glad to hear that! It sounds like your preparation paid off. How did you feel afterward?
I felt a huge sense of relief and accomplishment. It was nice to receive positive feedback from my colleagues too.
That’s wonderful! Positive reinforcement can be so motivating. Have you noticed any changes in your confidence since that experience?
Definitely! I feel more confident in my abilities to handle similar situations in the future.
That’s an important realization. Building confidence can significantly impact your overall well-being. How has your connection with your niece and nephew been since your outing?
We went to a movie together last weekend, and we had a great time again. They really seem to enjoy spending time with me.
That’s heartwarming! It sounds like you’re establishing a strong bond with them. How does that make you feel?
It makes me really happy. I love seeing them smile and having fun together.
That’s beautiful. It’s clear that you’re making a positive impact in their lives. Have you thought about any future activities you’d like to do with them?
I want to take them to a science museum next. I think they would love it!
That sounds like a great idea! Engaging them in educational activities can be very enriching. Now, let’s revisit your relationship with your brother. How has that been going?
We’ve had a few more conversations, and while we still disagree, I think we’re understanding each other better.
That’s a significant improvement. It sounds like you’re both working towards better communication. Are there any specific techniques you’ve found helpful in these conversations?
I’ve been trying to ask more questions and really listen to his point of view.
That’s an excellent approach. Asking questions can foster deeper understanding. Have you found any common ground during your discussions?
A little bit. We both care about our parents, and I think that’s a good starting point.
Absolutely! Focusing on shared values can help bridge differences. Is there anything else on your mind today that you’d like to explore?
I’ve been thinking about my career path lately. I’m not sure if I want to continue in finance or explore something new.
That’s a big consideration. What’s prompting you to think about a change?
I’ve been feeling a bit unfulfilled lately, and I want to make sure I’m doing something that truly excites me.
It’s important to feel fulfilled in your career. Have you thought about what areas you might like to explore?
I’ve always been interested in teaching or mentoring, but I’m not sure how to transition into that.
Teaching can be a very rewarding path. Perhaps we can explore ways to gain experience in that area. Would you be open to setting a goal to research opportunities or volunteer in teaching?
Yes, I’d like that! I’ll look into local programs or workshops.
That sounds like a productive plan. It’s great to see you considering new possibilities. As we wrap up today, what’s one takeaway you’d like to focus on until our next session?
I want to focus on exploring teaching opportunities and continue nurturing my relationships with my family.
Those are excellent goals! I’m excited to hear about your progress next time. Take care!
Thank you, Ellie! I appreciate your support. Bye!
Bye!
